title: Reflected XSS due to vulnerable version of sockjs

profile.name: Automattic
profile.about: WordPress.com, VaultPress, Akismet, Gravatar, WooCommerce, Polldaddy, Tumblr and more!

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
There is reflected XSS on *.simperium.com. The bug exists due to a vulnerable version of sockjs library.

## Platform(s) Affected:
simperium.com
js.simperium.com

## Steps To Reproduce:
  1. Visit https://simperium.com/sock/1/0/0/0/htmlfile?c=alert('XSS')//
  2. You will see an alert message because of executed JS

## Impact

XSS may be used by an attacker to perform a lot of things, for example, to steal user session

activities.message:
sockjs versions < 0.3.0 are vulnerable, reason - /lib/transport/htmlfile.js and its function htmlfile is not checking the non-alphanumeric symbols.
To mitigate it - update the version of sockjs library.
Thank you for your submission! We were able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review.

Hello @ivanov_ant,

Thank you for your submission! We were able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Regards,
@bugseeker

Hi team!
Do you have any updates?
Hi @ivanov_ant - we have what we believe is a fix and hope to have it deployed very soon. Thanks for your patience with us. Will try and get you an update within the next 24 hours.

Hi @dmsnell !
Thank you for the update, I will wait for fix.

Hi, @dmsnell !
I see that bug still works. If required, I will be glad to help.

@chip_sec - thanks for coming back for an update. we've been delayed by other high priority tickets here so it isn't yet deployed. new target is tomorrow; we will come back and update in this thread once it's updated.
@chip_sec we have deployed our update and the `sockjs` library should no longer expose that XSS. you can test again to confirm our findings. much obliged.

Hi @dmsnell!
I have checked it and confirm that the bug is fixed now.

Hi team!

Can we disclose it?

Hi @chip_sec,

Sure - going ahead with disclosure.
